conclusion: Analyze the relationship between the light source, the objects, and the shadows they cast.
Shadow A is cast by the birdcage.
Shadow B is cast by the skull.
Shadow C is cast by the chicken leg.
The current shadows are positioned directly below their respective objects.
The light source is currently directly above the objects.
When the light source moves to the right, it will no longer be directly above the objects but will be at an angle from the right side.
The change in the angle of the light source will cause the shadows to shift and elongate.
Shadow A will move to the left of the birdcage and become longer.
Shadow B will move to the left of the skull and become longer.
Shadow C will move to the left of the chicken leg and become longer.
As the light source moves to the right, the shadows will become larger because the light rays are hitting the objects at a more oblique angle.
The shadows will stretch out further to the left due to the increased angle of the light source.
When the light source moves to the right above the objects, shadows A, B, and C will all move to the left and become larger.
